text: Now the word of the Lord came unto Jonah the son of Amittai, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and cry out against it; for their wickedness has come up before Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jonah rose up to flee unto Tarshish from the presence of the Lord; and he went down to Joppa, and found a ship going to Tarshish. So he paid the fare thereof, and went down into it to go with them unto Tarshish from the presence of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord sent out a great wind into the sea, and there was a mighty tempest in the sea, so that the ship was likely to be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the mariners were afraid, and cried every man unto his god, and cast forth the wares that were in the ship into the sea to lighten it of them. But Jonah had gone down into the inner parts of the ship, and he lay and was fast asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the shipmaster came to him and said unto him, “What meanest thou, O sleeper? Arise, call upon thy God, if it so be that God will think upon us, that we perish not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said every one to his fellow, “Come, and let us cast lots, that we may know for whose cause this evil is upon us.” So they cast lots, and the lot fell upon Jonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said they unto him, “Tell us, we pray thee, for whose cause this evil is upon us: What is thine occupation? And from whence comest thou? What is thy country? And of what people art thou?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, “I am a Hebrew; and I fear the Lord, the God of heaven, who hath made the sea and the dry land.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then were the men exceedingly afraid, and said unto him, “Why hast thou done this?” For the men knew that he fled from the presence of the Lord, because he had told them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said they unto him, “What shall we do unto thee, that the sea may be calm unto us?” For the sea grew more and more tempestuous.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, “Take me up and cast me forth into the sea. So shall the sea be calm unto you, for I know that for my sake this great tempest is upon you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless the men rowed hard to bring it to the land; but they could not, for the sea was wroughtup and was tempestuous against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they cried unto the Lord and said, “We beseech Thee, O Lord, we beseech Thee, let us not perish for this man’s life, and lay not upon us innocent blood! For Thou, O Lord, hast done as it pleased Thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they took up Jonah and cast him forth into the sea, and the sea ceased from her raging.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men feared the Lord exceedingly, and offered a sacrifice unto the Lord and made vows.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord had prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jonah prayed unto the Lord his God out of the fish’s belly,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said: “I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord, and He heard me. Out of the belly of hell cried I, and Thou heardest my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Thou hadst cast me into the deep, in the midst of the seas, and the floods compassed me about; all Thy billows and Thy waves passed over me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said, ‘I am cast out of Thy sight; yet I will look again toward Thy holy temple.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The waters compassed me about, even to the soul; the depth closed me round about, the weeds were wrapped about my head.
speaker: Narrator

text: I went down to the bottoms of the mountains; the earth with her bars was about me for ever; yet hast Thou brought up my life from corruption, O Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When my soul fainted within me I remembered the Lord; and my prayer came in unto Thee, into Thine holy temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that observe lying vanities forsake their own mercy,
speaker: Narrator

text: but I will sacrifice unto Thee with the voice of thanksgiving; I will pay that which I have vowed. Salvation is of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spoke unto the fish, and it vomited out Jonah upon the dry land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came unto Jonah the second time, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Arise, go unto Nineveh, that great city, and preach unto it the preaching that I bid thee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jonah arose and went unto Nineveh, according to the word of the Lord. Now Nineveh was an exceeding great city of three days’ journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jonah began to enter into the city a day’s journey, and he cried and said, “Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people of Nineveh believed God, and proclaimed a fast and put on sackcloth, from the greatest of them even to the least of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For word came unto the king of Nineveh; and he arose from his throne, and he laid his robe from him, and covered himself with sackcloth and sat in ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he caused it to be proclaimed and published through Nineveh by the decree of the king and his nobles, saying, “Let neither man nor beast, herd nor flock, taste anything; let them not feed, nor drink water.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let man and beast be covered with sackcloth and cry mightily unto God. Yea, let them turn every one from his evil way, and from the violence that is in their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can tell if God will turn and repent, and turn away from His fierce anger, that we perish not?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And God saw their works, that they turned from their evil way. And God repented of the evil that He had said that He would do unto them, and He did it not.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was very angry.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he prayed unto the Lord and said, “I pray Thee, O Lord, was not this what I said when I was yet in my country? Therefore I fled before unto Tarshish; for I knew that Thou art a gracious God and merciful, slow to anger and of great kindness, and repentest of the evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore now, O Lord, take, I beseech Thee, my life from me, for it is better for me to die than to live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the Lord, “Doest thou well to be angry?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jonah went out of the city and sat on the east side of the city, and there made himself a booth and sat under it in the shadow till he might see what would become of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord God prepared a gourd, and made it to come up over Jonah, that it might be a shadow over his head to deliver him from his grief. So Jonah was exceeding glad for the gourd.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God prepared a worm when the morning rose the next day, and it smote the gourd so that it withered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when the sun arose, that God prepared a vehement east wind; and the sun beat upon the head of Jonah, so that he grew faint and wished in himself to die, and said, “It is better for me to die than to live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said to Jonah, “Doest thou well to be angry over the gourd?” And he said, “I do well to be angry, even unto death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the Lord, “Thou hast had pity on the gourd for which thou hast not labored, neither madest it grow, which came up in a night and perished in a night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And should not I spare Nineveh, that great city, wherein are more than sixscore thousand persons who cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand, and also many cattle?”
speaker: Narrator
